channel.title: Anyone see the new scam? I lost 1.4M to it
channel.description:
Hey,
I'm pretty sure it's new, but I think people should know about it either way. Here's how the scam works.
1. Someone says they're selling dragon bones at 1.8-1.9k which is wayyy below normal price. 2. Trade window comes up, they put up noted b bones, you don't really tell. 3. You accept, and your to happy that you got such a great deal you don't notice they're the wrong type of bones in the second window. 4. You log out to go bury, take them out of noted form, and FUCKKKK!!!!! I got pwnd!
I lost 1.4M to this. It sucked.

I feel for this trick once. I was buying big bones and the guy gave me 800 bones noted. I just saw the bones and then accepted on the second trade window. But it paid back easily just 1 or 2 hours later.

item.title: Anyone see the new scam? I lost 1.4M to it
item.dc:creator: @exe626 exe626
item.description:
@exe626 wrote:

This has been around for a few years now, as most of the scams said have been. Thats why they added that second trade window, so you can read it over and confirm this transaction. Now they even have completly eliminated swapping the item with something else scam, its your own fault for not thinking and reading the second window.

Read full topic

item.title: Anyone see the new scam? I lost 1.4M to it
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

exps35:

You never know when things are going to be worth alot, or worth crap. Me and my friend played RSC during the party hat drop. We each had at least 5 pairs of every color, and were practically handing them out to random people. They went up to like, 5k each so we sold the majority of them. 3 years later they go for about… 20m each now or something?

Hindsight is 20/20. That’s why you apply that to current principles.

If Jagex releases a set amount of something and allows it to be traded, that item will be worth a shitload. If they say they’ll add ‘new prayers,’ buy a crapload of bones. If they say they’ll add some new additions to construction, buy up planks.

Read full topic
item.source: Anyone see the new scam? I lost 1.4M to it

We gotta look at the monthly updates section more often. If they subtly promise something, we’ll buy anything related en masse and make bux.[/quote]
